repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

comment_data.body: @zeertzjq I left the mention of `<sfile>` here for now. All other changes should be correct now.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -78,6 +78,9 @@ exception is that "<sfile>" is expanded when the autocmd is defined.  Example:
 	:au BufNewFile,BufRead *.html so <sfile>:h/html.vim

comment_data.body: Should this change be documented in `:h news-breaking-dev`?
This doesn't look right. `<script>` may be any random script that edits an html file, or no script at all in case the file in open from the command line.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -87,7 +90,7 @@ that you can easily clear them: >
 	augroup vimrc
 	  " Remove all vimrc autocommands
 	  autocmd!
-	  au BufNewFile,BufRead *.html so <sfile>:h/html.vim
+	  au BufNewFile,BufRead *.html so <script>:h/html.vim

comment_data.body: I'm not sure if one will ever want to avoid that for a `BufNewFile,BufRead` autocommand. Maybe a `User` autocommand makes more sense.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -78,6 +78,9 @@ exception is that "<sfile>" is expanded when the autocmd is defined.  Example:
 	:au BufNewFile,BufRead *.html so <sfile>:h/html.vim
 
 Here Vim expands <sfile> to the name of the file containing this line.
+Use <script> instead to avoid that: >
+
+	:au BufNewFile,BufRead *.html so <script>:h/html.vim

@@ -87,7 +90,7 @@ that you can easily clear them: >
 	augroup vimrc
 	  " Remove all vimrc autocommands
 	  autocmd!
-	  au BufNewFile,BufRead *.html so <sfile>:h/html.vim
+	  au BufNewFile,BufRead *.html so <script>:h/html.vim

@@ -87,7 +90,7 @@ that you can easily clear them: >
 	augroup vimrc
 	  " Remove all vimrc autocommands
 	  autocmd!
-	  au BufNewFile,BufRead *.html so <sfile>:h/html.vim
+	  au BufNewFile,BufRead *.html so <script>:h/html.vim

@@ -78,6 +78,9 @@ exception is that "<sfile>" is expanded when the autocmd is defined.  Example:
 	:au BufNewFile,BufRead *.html so <sfile>:h/html.vim
 
 Here Vim expands <sfile> to the name of the file containing this line.
+Use <script> instead to avoid that: >
+
+	:au BufNewFile,BufRead *.html so <script>:h/html.vim

comment_regular_data.body: Some of the `<sfile>` -> `<script>` changes are wrong. (For example, `<sfile>` has special behavior in `:autocmd`, while `<script>` doesn't) Please check the actual behavior and do not blindly replace `<sfile>` with `<script>`.
Ah, actually there may a be problem with `:autocmd` behavior. See vim/vim#17569.

I think there should be a tag`*virtual-text*` (maybe somewhere near `*extmarks*`?). I remember that I only discovered the API for that feature thanks to the _deprecated_ tag `*nvim_buf_set_virtual_text*`

yeah there are some differences,

```
au BufEnter * echom "<sfile>:h"
au BufEnter * echom "<script>:h"
au BufEnter * echom expand('<sfile>:h')
au BufEnter * echom expand('<script>:h')
```

`:source` then `:au BufEnter` shows:

```
BufEnter
*echom "."
echom "<script>:h"
echom expand('.')
echom expand('<script>:h')
```

and `:edit` prints:

```
.
<script>:h
.
.
```

labels.description: Nvim defaults for options, colorscheme/theme, autocmds/events, etc.
labels.name: defaults
